Topic.Title: Hannity Defends Racist Rodeo Clown at MO State Fair

Message.Msg: This was not a free speech issue, Don. It was a case of classlessness and crudity. Free speech was never in question. It was a matter of subjecting people to a political philosophy they did not care for, and they complained. They were members of the public and it was publicly funded. In other words, some customers were not satisfied. There were kids present. Breast feeding could be seen as free expression, too, Don, but some Chick fil-A's (sp?) don't allow THAT either. The guys -- the PA commentator more than the clown -- deserved to be chastised for inappropriate material They should be made to sit a few out and think about it, just as professional sports players sometimes have to do. Did you come to see the bull riding of to smell the bull ----?

Message.Title: Glenn Greenwald's Partner Detained At UK Airport Under Terrorism Act
Message.Msg: Remember when Obonzo addressed Ohio State graduates and told then they could implicitly trust Big Brother Government? Here is Glen Greenwald's response to UK and USA intimidation and harassment. "This is obviously a rather profound escalation of their attacks on the news-gathering process and journalism. It's bad enough to prosecute and imprison sources. It's worse still to imprison journalists who report the truth. But to start detaining the family members and loved ones of journalists is simply despotic. Even the Mafia had ethical rules against targeting the family members of people they feel threatened by. But the UK puppets and their owners in the US national security state obviously are unconstrained by even those minimal scruples. If the UK and US governments believe that tactics like this are going to deter or intimidate us in any way from continuing to report aggressively on what these documents reveal, they are beyond deluded. If anything, it will have only the opposite effect: to embolden us even further. Beyond that, every time the US and UK governments show their true character to the world - when they prevent the Bolivian President's plane from flying safely home, when they threaten journalists with prosecution, when they engage in behavior like what they did today - all they do is helpfully underscore why it's so dangerous to allow them to exercise vast, unchecked spying power in the dark."

Topic.Title: My Impersonation of HoozdikHertz

Message.Msg: Spartacus, Solomon wrote Ecclesiastes after a long and rich life, full of wealth, wisdom, wine, and women. In Ecclesiastes 12:13,14, he wrote, "Now all has been heard; here is the conclusion of the matter: Fear God and keep his commandments, for this is the duty of all mankind. For God will bring every deed into judgment, including every hidden thing, whether it is good or evil." One of the Proverbs points out what determines or distinguishes wisdom: "The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding." (Proverbs 9:10) And who is the "Holy One"? It is Jesus. Even the demons know who Jesus is: "What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are--the Holy One of God!" (Mark 1:24) Reading and understanding God's Word is the right thing to do; knowing Jesus as your Savior is what this life is all about (John 14:6).

Message.Title: Profiteering by Keeping Americans Terrified
Message.Msg: Michael Hayden, the former director of the National Security Agency, has invaded America’s television sets in recent weeks to warn about Edward Snowden’s leaks and the continuing terrorist threat to America. But what often goes unmentioned, as the Guardian’s Glenn Greenwald pointed out, is that Hayden has a financial stake in keeping Americans scared and on a permanent war footing against Islamist militants. And the private firm he works for, called the Chertoff Group, is not the only one making money by scaring Americans. Post-9/11 America has witnessed a boom in private firms dedicated to the hyped-up threat of terrorism. The drive to privatize America's national security apparatus accelerated in the aftermath of the terrorist attacks, and it’s gotten to the point where 70 percent of the national intelligence budget is now spent on private contractors, as author Tim Shorrock reported. The private intelligence contractors have profited to the tune of at least $6 billion a year. In 2010, the Washington Post revealed that there are 1,931 private firms across the country dedicated to fighting terrorism. What it all adds up to is a massive industry profiting off government-induced fear of terrorism, even though Americans are more likely to be killed by a car crash or their own furniture than a terror attack.

Message.Title: Stupid Things Republicans Say And Do
Message.Msg: Larry Klayman: America 'Has Been Hijacked by Islam and Our President Is the leader of this Muslim Revolution' Conservatives are predictably freaking out that a tiny fringe group closely linked to the 9/11 Truthers is organizing a “Million Muslim March” in Washington D.C. on September 11. In a WorldNetDaily column, Larry Klayman suggests that President Obama is behind the march—the name of which has since been changed to the “Million American March Against Fear”—and believes he might even speak at the rally: “They have been given a virtual green light to do so by the mullah in chief. And, even if he does not show his devilish face at this highly provocative demonstration of the growing Islamic influence in the United States and abroad, Obama will be there with his fellow Muslims in spirit.” Klayman, who links to another WND article that wonders if Obama is the Antichrist, goes on to accuse Obama of supporting the Muslim Brotherhood and charging that the President fears the US military “may one day rise up and oust him and his comrades,” calling on readers to pray for a coup so that “we the People will soon be liberated from this modern-day pharaoh.” Finally, there is good news in the Middle East. The Egyptian military, having removed the Muslim Brotherhood President Mohamed Morsi after he and his terrorist group hijacked the democratic process, is now in the act of systematically destroying this Islamic cancer on the Arab state’s secular body politic. But the good news for Egypt and by extension Israel, its Jewish neighbor, is bad news for Barack Hussein Obama, our so-called “Muslim president.”

Message.Title: F-15 silent eagle
Message.Msg: By Joyce Lee SEOUL Aug 19 (Reuters) - Boeing's bid in the 8.3 trillion won ($7.4 billion) tender to supply South Korea with 60 fighter aircraft was the only one below the price ceiling set by the country's arms procurement agency, sources close to the process said on Monday. A final decision was not expected until mid-September, the sources said, but the price submitted by the U.S. company appears to be a significant step toward winning the contract. Boeing is pitching the latest variant of its F-15 fighter, dubbed the F-15 Silent Eagle, against the Eurofighter consortium's Typhoon and Lockheed Martin's F-35 stealth jet.

Topic.Title: What is up with the low delivery rates and all the Q.C. problems--make people resonsible!!

Message.Msg: Actually they are on track to deliver well over 50 planes this month. With half the month over, they have delivered 28 planes and have a high number of first flights completed. As for Q.A issues, having quality checks by QA does more damage than good. Workers can simply say to themselves "I dont need to check my work because Q/A will find any problems." Putting the ownership of the work quality on the workers themselves rather than on Q/A inspectors has improved quality accross the manufacturing industry. Those companies which stick to the old Q/A model continue to suffer (just ask Kiddie).

Topic.Title: My Impersonation of HoozdikHertz

Message.Msg: Hooz, Well, of course, it is opinion based upon the reality of my personal experience, but stating it as fact as a generality is also not inaccurate. I know that you like to often quote what Jesus has said - I presume for the authority of His knowledge and the fact of His being the Son of God. And, I offer this as well: Jesus answered, "It is written: 'Man shall not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.' " (Matthew 4:4). If it is indeed a fact that man shall live by every word that comes out of the mouth of God, then my statement, while it is certainly my opinion, Jesus has thus said in Matthew 4:4 that it is also a fact. BB

Topic.Title: What is up with the low delivery rates and all the Q.C. problems--make people resonsible!!

Message.Msg: Self checking sounds good in theory doesn't work as well in practice. I would not allow it in my organization unless I knew the fabricator and even then I would do spot checks occasionally. And I would NEVER allow outside contractors to do self checks. Was asked to consult on a quality issue for another group. What we found was that self checking worked well at first but gradually the quality would slip, particularly if there was schedule pressure. One of my peers received a batch of assemblies from Charleston for testing. Quality was so bad he sent them back. He wanted to send a QC inspector on site but Charleston would not allow them in because they were IAM!

Harding 522 Calvin Coolidge 1,203 Herbert Hoover 968 Franklin D. Roosevelt 3,522 Harry S. Truman 907 Dwight D. Eisenhower 484 John F. Kennedy 214 Lyndon B. Johnson 325 Richard Nixon 346 Gerald R. Topic.Title: The U.S. has a $7.25 minimum wage. Australia’s is $16.88

Message.Msg: I will try this again: The exchange rate makes some difference, but Australia has a graduated rate based upon age and being on an apprentice program: Age 16: Aus ($6.03); US ($5.49); 17 years: $9.46/$8.61; 18 years: $11.18/$10.17; 19 years: $13.51/$12.29; 20 years: $16.00 /$14.56 Apprentice program: $9.46 to $16.00 (US, $8.61 to $14.56) The US minimum wage in 1970 was $1.70. In today's dollars, that would be $10.23 (on-line inflation calculator) Here is what the Bible has to say (don't skip this): "Now to the one who works, his wages are not counted as a gift but as his due." (Romans 4:4) "You shall not oppress your neighbor or rob him. The wages of a hired servant shall not remain with you all night until the morning." (Leviticus 19:13) “Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness, and his upper rooms by injustice, who makes his neighbor serve him for nothing and does not give him his wages." (Jeremiah 22:13) Some might rationalize that a low/oppressive minimum wage is being lawful, but they will have a hard time explaining that to Jesus - assuming that they care.
